revision.text: {{ArticleHistory |action1=FAC |action1date=22:29, 6 September 2008 |action1link=Wikipedia:Featured article candidates/Phan Xich Long |action1result=promoted |action1oldid=236648799 |dykdate=February 28 2008 |currentstatus=FA |maindate=November 16, 2008 }} {{WikiProjectBannerShell|1= {{WikiProject Vietnam|class=FA|importance=low}} {{WikiProject Biography|living=no|class=FA|military-work-group=yes|military-priority=low|listas=Phan, Xich Long}} {{WPMILHIST|class=FA|Southeast-Asian=yes|Biography=yes}} }} {{OnThisDay|date1=2010-03-22|oldid1=351415060|date2=2011-03-22|oldid2=420114553|date3=2013-03-22|oldid3=545915494|date4=2016-03-22|oldid4=711325656}} == what? == "In Fetailed strategy from his prison cell, and the attack was led by a Cholon gang leader named Nguyen Van Truoc with Tri's assistance." What does that mean? Should that be 'In detailed strategy from his prison cell ''something something'' and the attack was...' :Nevermind, was result of vandalism.--[[User:EchetusXe|EchetusXe]] ([[User talk:EchetusXe|talk]]) 01:33, 16 November 2008 (UTC) == 'Coronate' in homepage version == The lead of the current version of this article refers to the subject planning to 'crown himself'. The version on the homepage says 'coronate himself'. As coronate isn't a word, can we have the homepage version fixed, please? [[User:AlexTiefling|AlexTiefling]] ([[User talk:AlexTiefling|talk]]) 01:51, 16 November 2008 (UTC) :I considered it last night, but "coronate" is a word [http://www.onelook.com/?w=coronate&ls=a] [http://books.google.com/books?lr=&q=%22coronate+himself%22&btnG=Search+Books], although "crown" is more common. [[User:Art LaPella|Art LaPella]] ([[User talk:Art LaPella|talk]]) 04:45, 16 November 2008 (UTC) == strange last alinea == The articles last alinea is very fascinating, yet strange, apart from Phan himself being not someone i really heard or saw mention, there have been spiritualy motivated mass movements against colonialism by bunches there.. ok. Ofcourse. Yet it concerns a 'million' of people, and there is a whole 1(!) reference in all western literature. Strange? fascinating. Is there more? I think it would reward article's.[[Special:Contributions/80.57.67.243|80.57.67.243]] ([[User talk:80.57.67.243|talk]]) 04:32, 16 November 2008 (UTC) Saltpetre,carbon and sulphur when mixed are gunpowder and the sentence on the bombs is unwieldy and unclear. For the bombs it should probably say "shot and homemade gunpowder". Certainly it should not say canon shot as that implies canon balls which would be most impractical. —Preceding [[Wikipedia:Signatures|unsigned]] comment added by [[Special:Contributions/157.203.255.1|157.203.255.1]] ([[User talk:157.203.255.1|talk]]) 15:06, 22 March 2011 (UTC) == Vandalism == I'm watching this page today to revert any vandalism caused by the high amount of views on the article. [[User:Trillio|Trillio]] ([[User talk:Trillio|talk]]) 14:41, 16 November 2008 (UTC) ==photos== Hi, the current photo of Phan Xich Long isn't clear to show his face. Does anyone have a better photo? --[[User:Winstonlighter|Winstonlighter]] ([[User talk:Winstonlighter|talk]]) 10:58, 19 August 2010 (UTC)
